channel.title: Velociraptor Artifact Exchange
channel.description: Recent content in Artifact Exchange on Velociraptor - Digging deeper!

item.title: Linux.Debian.GPGKeys
item.description: Extract keys, fingerprints and identities from GPG keys.

item.title: Windows.Events.TrackProcesses.UseExistingSysmonOnly
item.description: **This is a modified version of Windows.Events.TrackProcesses for servers that do not use the Inventory service. It assumes that Sysmon is already installed and running. The option to forward updates to the server is also removed.**

item.title: Linux.PrivilegeEscalationDetection
item.description: This artifact searches for potential privilege escalation indicators on Linux systems. It identifies processes running as root that were spawned by processes not running as root, which could indicate unauthorized privilege escalation. Created by Leonardo Grossi.

item.title: Generic.Forensics.CyLR
item.description: Uses CyLR tool to do live forensic on the host.

item.title: Windows.Registry.DefenderConfig
item.description: Thit artifact enables extracting Windows Defender configuration from SOFTWARE registry hive.

item.title: Server.Alerts.Mattermost
item.description: Create a Slack/Mattermost notification when a client Flow (with artifacts of interest) has finished. Cancelled collections and collections with artifacts that don't satisfy preconditions do not create notifications when they are stopped.

item.title: Custom.Windows.Nirsoft.LastActivityView
item.description: LastActivityView is a tool for Windows operating system that collects information from various sources on a running system, and displays a log of actions made by the user and events occurred on this computer. The activity displayed by LastActivityView includes: Running .exe file, Opening open/save dialog-box, Opening file/folder from Explorer or other software, software installation, system shutdown/start, application or system crash, network connection/disconnection and more...

item.title: Windows.Registry.PrintNightmare
item.description: CVE-2021-34527 or Windows Print Spooler Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

item.title: Exchange.Linux.Kunai
item.description: Kunai is a Linux-based security monitoring and threat hunting tool written in Rust. This artifact parses the Kunai log file.

item.title: Linux.Detection.SSHKeyFileCmd
item.description: This artifact will parse ~/.ssh/authorized_keys and ~/.ssh/id_*.pub looking for the command option to detect potential persistence

item.title: Linux.Detection.MemFD
item.description: This artifact will parse /proc/*/exe files and look for processes that have been executed from memory via memfd_create()

item.title: IRIS.Timeline.Add
item.description: This artifact adds Velociraptor rows as timeline entries to DFIR-IRIS (https://dfir-iris.org/). It will link the assets and IOCs as specified in the parameters. Additionally, if the client is not yet existing in Iris, this artifact will leverage the IRIS.Sync.Asset artifact to add the asset to Iris first and link it in the event.

item.title: Windows.EventLogs.MoveIt
item.description: This Artifact enables scoping EventLogs from Progress Software's MoveIT File Transfer. It is designed to assist in identifying exfiltration resulting from the exploitation of CVE-2023-34362

item.title: Windows.Detection.MoveIt
item.description: This is an artifact to detect exploitation of a MoveIt critical vulnerability observed in the wild. CVE-2023-34362

item.title: Server.Enrichment.Strelka.FileScan
item.description: Submit a file to Strelka for analysis using `strelka-oneshot`.

item.title: Windows.Forensics.RecentFileCache
item.description: Parses the RecentFileCache as evidence of execution artifact existing on older Windows systems (<= Win 7).

item.title: Windows.Applications.LECmd
item.description: Execute Eric Zimmerman's LECmd and return output for analysis. Created using @eduardfir SBECmd VQL as a quide. LECmd is a CLI tool for analyzing lnk data. Learn more - https://github.com/EricZimmerman/LECmd

item.title: PSList.VTLookup
item.description: Combination of PSList with Virus Total reputation lookup using the Virus Total Server Enrichment Artifact by Wes Lambert.

item.title: Server.Alerts.Monitor.IRIS
item.description: Create an IRIS alert when monitored artifacts complete with results. Alerts are available starting in version 2.1.0 of IRIS. https://github.com/dfir-iris/iris-web/releases/tag/v2.1.0

item.title: Server.Notification.Mattermost
item.description: Send notification via Mattermost webhook as described in <https://developers.mattermost.com/integrate/webhooks/incoming/>

item.title: Windows.PersistenceSniper
item.description: PersistenceSniper is a Powershell module that can be used by Blue Teams, Incident Responders and System Administrators to hunt persistences implanted in Windows machines. It is also available on Powershell Gallery and it is digitally signed with a valid code signing certificate. The tool is under active development with new releases coming out by the week, so make sure to use the up-to-date version. https://github.com/last-byte/PersistenceSniper

item.title: MacOS.System.Man
item.description: `man` is typically used to provide information about how to use various commands. It's configuration file is located at `/private/etc/man.conf` on most macOS systems.

item.title: Windows.Generic.Internet.BlockAccess
item.description: Simply adds a new inbound or outbound firewall rule that filters traffic by allowing or blocking network packets that match the specified criteria via `netsh advfirewall add rule` command. Applicable in case of blocking Internet access.

item.title: Windows.Forensics.Clipboard
item.description: This artifact will show the Clipboard activity.

item.title: MacOS.Logs.MacMonitor
item.description: This artifact parses JSONL-formatted logs generated by MacMonitor.

item.title: Alert.Windows.EVTX.PowerPickHostVersion
item.description: This artifact by itself only indicates that the PowerPick tool may have been invoked on the client. To capture additional context, ensure that Powershell script block and module logging are enabled on the clients and deploy the Windows.ETW.Powershell artifact from the Exchange.

item.title: Windows.Carving.BumbleBee
item.description: This artficat will detect running BumbleBee processes and subsequently extract the command and control servers with the destination port 443.

item.title: Server.Telegram.Clients.Enrolled
item.description: Send a message to telegram when clients become enrolled.

item.title: Windows.Registry.Domain
item.description: Checks the configured domain name on each endpoint

item.title: Windows.Carving.Qakbot
item.description: This artifact enables Qakbot payload detection and configuration extraction from a byte stream, process or file on disk. The artifact runs a yara scan as a detection step, then attempts to process the payload to extract configuration.

item.title: MacOS.Applications.Firefox.History
item.description: Read all Users Firefox history.

item.title: Windows.Detection.SmoothOperator
item.description: This artifact searches for evidence of trojanised 3CXDesktopApp.

item.title: Detection.Application.CursedChrome
item.description: Detects the [Cursed Chrome](https://github.com/mandatoryprogrammer/CursedChrome) extension. Starts by searching for permissive extensions configured within `Secure Preferences`. Locates the path of the extensions and scans using Yara.

item.title: Windows.Detection.RemoteIconForcedAuth
item.description: Attackers plant SCF, URL, and LNK files with malicious icon file paths on file shares to escalate privileges or maintain persistence. This attack only requires the user to browse to the location of the malicious file. This artifact enumerates file shares and returns an event for each file with a remote icon. It can also scan a target root directory since attackers commonly use other locations like desktops.

item.title: Windows.Registry.Bulk.ComputerName
item.description: This looks through registry on all disks to determine the hostname for cases where multiple disks are mounted

item.title: Linux.LogAnalysis.ChopChopGo
item.description: This artifact leverages ChopChopGo to enable usage of Sigma rules to faciliate detection within Linux logs.

item.title: Windows.Detection.ScmanagerBackdoor
item.description: Checks for overly permissive DACLs on scmanager. Low priv Users with KA - SDDL_KEY_ALL could launch SYSTEM services.

item.title: Server.Enrichment.Sublime.EmailAnalysis
item.description: Submit an email to Sublime for analysis.

item.title: Windows.Memory.InjectedThreadEx
item.description: This artifact runs Get-InjetedThreadEx to detect process injection and hooking.

item.title: Generic.Collection.UAC
item.description: This artifact leverages UAC (Unix-like Artifacts Collector) to collect artifacts from Unix-like systems, then uploads the output to the Velociraptor server.

item.title: Windows.Detection.PipeHunter
item.description: Takes a pipe name and returns the owning process and access rights. The primary motivation for this artifact is a vulnerability in RemCom. RemCom is most notably used by impacket psexec.py. It creates a null DACL for its communication pipe. This means a low privileged user could use a stale pipe to get remote execution as SYSTEM. If you uncover any named pipes with the name RemCom_communication, investigate the owning proc and remove it from the system. #impacket

item.title: Linux.Detection.vRealizeLogInsightExploitation
item.description: Checks for exploitation of vRealize Log Insight VMSA-2023-0001 exploitation artifacts. The presence of a path traversal in the FileName field is evidence of compromise. There is still a path to exploitation without leveraging the path traversal vuln. Any attempt to run REMOTE_PAK_DOWNLOAD_COMMAND from a non-vRealize server is malicious. #VMWare #vRealize #exploit

item.title: Windows.Detection.Onenote
item.description: This artifact enables detection of malicious .one files and can also be used as an embedded file and metadata parser.

item.title: Windows.Persistence.VscodeTasks
item.description: This artifact parses VSCode configuration files to find potenital persistence.

item.title: Windows.MobaXterm.Passwords
item.description: Extract MobaXterm encrypted saved Master Passwords, Passwords and Credentials from registry. Further information regarding decryption can be found here: https://www.xmcyber.com/blog/extracting-encrypted-credentials-from-common-tools-2/

item.title: Server.Utils.DeleteClientLabel
item.description: This artifact completely removes a client from the data store if a configured label is set.

item.title: Windows.Detection.PublicIP
item.description: This artifact queries for RDP and Authentication events with a Public IP source. The artifact uses Windows.EventLogs.RDPAuth and has several built in notebooks for analysis.

item.title: Windows.WinSCP.Passwords
item.description: Extract WinSCP obfuscated saved passwords from registry. Further information regarding deobfuscation can be found here: https://www.xmcyber.com/blog/extracting-encrypted-credentials-from-common-tools-2/

item.title: Generic.Detection.ManageEngineLog
item.description: This artifact will enable discovery of logs associated with observed exploitation of critical ManageEngine vulnerability: CVE-2022-47966.

item.title: Windows.Detection.ProxyHunter
item.description: This artifact detects evidence of several common proxy tools.
